title: Driveways
plot: Eight-year-old Cody is spending the summer in an unfamiliar setting with his mom Kathy. Though he can't relate to the neighbourhood kids, things take an unexpected turn when he develops an unusual friendship with grouchy old Del from next door.
stars: Hong Chau, Lucas Jaye, Brian Dennehy, Christine Ebersole

others.job: Second Unit Director or Assistant Director

items.name: Brandon Kelley
items.description: digital imaging technician / underwater camera operator

companies: CinemaWerks, Allusionist Picture House, Electric Panda Entertainment

plotShort.plainText:
Driveways (film)
Driveways is a 2019 American drama film directed by Andrew Ahn and starring Hong Chau, Lucas Jaye, and Brian Dennehy. The film had its world premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival on February 10, 2019. It was released on video-on-demand on May 7, 2020.
plotShort.html:
Driveways (film)

Driveways is a 2019 American drama film directed by Andrew Ahn and starring Hong Chau, Lucas Jaye, and Brian Dennehy. The film had its world premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival on February 10, 2019. It was released on video-on-demand on May 7, 2020.

plotFull.plainText:
Driveways (film)
Driveways is a 2019 American drama film directed by Andrew Ahn and starring Hong Chau, Lucas Jaye, and Brian Dennehy. The film had its world premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival on February 10, 2019. It was released on video-on-demand on May 7, 2020.
Synopsis
Tribeca Film Festival shares the synopsis, "Cody (Lucas Jaye) is a sweet, sensitive boy who doesn't always fit in easily with other kids his age. He's not bothered by spending the summer in an unfamiliar New York town while his mother, Kathy (Hong Chau), cleans out the house left behind by his recently deceased aunt, trying to ready it for sale. As Kathy, who'd been estranged from her reclusive sister for years, learns how much she didn't know about the late woman, Cody strikes up a surprising friendship with the gruff retiree who lives next door. Del (Brian Dennehy) is a Korean War vet who's been whiling away his days living alone, playing bingo with his pals, and sitting out on his porch. In Cody, he comes to see not just a solitary boy in need of connection but also a reflection of past regrets about his own family."
Cast
Hong Chau as Kathy
Lucas Jaye as Cody
Brian Dennehy as Del
Christine Ebersole as Linda
Jerry Adler as Rodger
Release
The film had its world premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival on February 10, 2019. It also screened at the Tribeca Film Festival on April 30, 2019. In December 2019, FilmRise acquired distribution rights to the film.
Critical reception
The review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes assigned the film an approval rating of 100%, based on 48 reviews assessed as positive or negative; the average rating among the reviews is 7.83/10. The similar website Metacritic surveyed 18 critics and assessed all 18 as positive. It gave an weighted average score of 83 out of 100, which it said indicated "universal acclaim".
Accolades
The film has been nominated for a 2020 Film Independent Spirit Award in the Best First Screenplay and Best Female Lead categories.
plotFull.html:
Driveways (film)

Driveways is a 2019 American drama film directed by Andrew Ahn and starring Hong Chau, Lucas Jaye, and Brian Dennehy. The film had its world premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival on February 10, 2019. It was released on video-on-demand on May 7, 2020.


Synopsis

Tribeca Film Festival shares the synopsis, "Cody (Lucas Jaye) is a sweet, sensitive boy who doesn't always fit in easily with other kids his age. He's not bothered by spending the summer in an unfamiliar New York town while his mother, Kathy (Hong Chau), cleans out the house left behind by his recently deceased aunt, trying to ready it for sale. As Kathy, who'd been estranged from her reclusive sister for years, learns how much she didn't know about the late woman, Cody strikes up a surprising friendship with the gruff retiree who lives next door. Del (Brian Dennehy) is a Korean War vet who's been whiling away his days living alone, playing bingo with his pals, and sitting out on his porch. In Cody, he comes to see not just a solitary boy in need of connection but also a reflection of past regrets about his own family."


Cast

  • Hong Chau as Kathy
  • Lucas Jaye as Cody
  • Brian Dennehy as Del
  • Christine Ebersole as Linda
  • Jerry Adler as Rodger

Release

The film had its world premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival on February 10, 2019. It also screened at the Tribeca Film Festival on April 30, 2019. In December 2019, FilmRise acquired distribution rights to the film.


Critical reception

The review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes assigned the film an approval rating of 100%, based on 48 reviews assessed as positive or negative; the average rating among the reviews is 7.83/10. The similar website Metacritic surveyed 18 critics and assessed all 18 as positive. It gave an weighted average score of 83 out of 100, which it said indicated "universal acclaim".


Accolades

The film has been nominated for a 2020 Film Independent Spirit Award in the Best First Screenplay and Best Female Lead categories.

similars.title: Exit 0
similars.plot: A young couple sets out on a weekend getaway in hopes of mending their failing relationship. However, a seemingly innocent weekend turns dark when the man discovers a videotape chronicling the events of a murder in his very own hotel room from years before.
similars.stars: Gabe Fazio, Augie Duke, Federico Castelluccio
